svg.text:
title: "Week in Ethereum News
October 28, 2023" date: "2023-10-27"
Eth News and Links
Dencun (Cancun + Deneb) upgrade
* Latest all core devs â€“ execution (ACDE) call video . Notes from Tim Beiko and
Christine Kim : Mainnet : upgrade likely to be 2024 (minimum 2 week gap between each
testnet upgrade) Goerli testnet : upgrade late November (at the earliest), CL clients
not ready yet Devnet 10 : normal & stress testing analysis, tested EIP7514 (max churn
limit) Devnet 11 : launch early next week, test all clients with MEV pipeline Goerli
shadow fork : launch early next week Discussed EIP7523 (empty accounts deprecation)
Latest all core devs â€“ execution (ACDE) call video . Notes from Tim Beiko and
Christine Kim :
* Mainnet : upgrade likely to be 2024 (minimum 2 week gap between each testnet
upgrade)
Mainnet : upgrade likely to be 2024 (minimum 2 week gap between each testnet upgrade)
* Goerli testnet : upgrade late November (at the earliest), CL clients not ready yet
Goerli testnet : upgrade late November (at the earliest), CL clients not ready yet
* Devnet 10 : normal & stress testing analysis, tested EIP7514 (max churn limit)
Devnet 10 : normal & stress testing analysis, tested EIP7514 (max churn limit)
* Devnet 11 : launch early next week, test all clients with MEV pipeline
Devnet 11 : launch early next week, test all clients with MEV pipeline
* Goerli shadow fork : launch early next week
Goerli shadow fork : launch early next week
* Discussed EIP7523 (empty accounts deprecation)
Discussed EIP7523 (empty accounts deprecation)
* Proposed Deneb simplification to attach the block header & an inclusion proof on
each blob sidecar
Proposed Deneb simplification to attach the block header & an inclusion proof on each
blob sidecar
Centralization watch: threatening the value of your ETH
* ðŸš¨ Lido at 31.51% has reduced again but still far too close to 33.3% threshold
ðŸš¨ Lido at 31.51% has reduced again but still far too close to 33.3% threshold
* Client diversity (via clientdiversity.org ): Execution layer: Geth ~84%
supermajority, could possibly cause a chain split Consensus layer: Prysm at 45%, any
client bug over 33.3% could mean loss of finality
Client diversity (via clientdiversity.org ):
* Execution layer: Geth ~84% supermajority, could possibly cause a chain split
Execution layer: Geth ~84% supermajority, could possibly cause a chain split
* Consensus layer: Prysm at 45%, any client bug over 33.3% could mean loss of finality
Consensus layer: Prysm at 45%, any client bug over 33.3% could mean loss of finality
* Geographic diversity needed for stakers & nodes , particularly outside of
US/Canada/EU
Geographic diversity needed for stakers & nodes , particularly outside of US/Canada/EU
Layer 1
* Verkle Kaustinen testnet back online, upgraded to Shapella, proof witnesses include
post state and adds Lodestar CL client
Client releases
* Consensus layer: Prysm v4.1.1 : patch to fix using REST API with external builder
and experimental state deadlock
Consensus layer:
* Prysm v4.1.1 : patch to fix using REST API with external builder and experimental
state deadlock
* Execution layer: Besu v23.10.1 : UX, memory and RPC performance improvements Erigon
v2.53.2 : fixes Nethermind v1.21.1 : hotfix for invalid block production
Execution layer:
* Besu v23.10.1 : UX, memory and RPC performance improvements
Besu v23.10.1 : UX, memory and RPC performance improvements
* Erigon v2.53.2 : fixes
Erigon v2.53.2 : fixes
* Nethermind v1.21.1 : hotfix for invalid block production
Nethermind v1.21.1 : hotfix for invalid block production
Research
* SubnetDAS : proposal for intermediate DAS approach with linkability of queries
tradeoff
SubnetDAS : proposal for intermediate DAS approach with linkability of queries
* Family of embedded curves for BLS
Family of embedded curves for BLS
Layer 2
* First monthly RollCall (Layer 2 protocol & EVM standardization) call video : intros,
Rollup Improvement Proposals (RIPs), EIP7212 (secp256r1 precompile) as first RIP,
Devconnect discussion topics and EIP7530 (EVM profiles)
* intros, Rollup Improvement Proposals (RIPs), EIP7212 (secp256r1 precompile) as first
RIP, Devconnect discussion topics and EIP7530 (EVM profiles)
EIPs/Standards
* ERCs split from EIPs
ERCs split from EIPs
* EIPs EIP7542 : eth/69 - available-blocks-extended protocol EIP7543 : EVM decimal
math (opcodes) EIP7545 : Verkle proof verification precompile
EIPs
* EIP7542 : eth/69 - available-blocks-extended protocol
EIP7542 : eth/69 - available-blocks-extended protocol
* EIP7543 : EVM decimal math (opcodes)
EIP7543 : EVM decimal math (opcodes)
* EIP7545 : Verkle proof verification precompile
EIP7545 : Verkle proof verification precompile
* ERCs (application layer): (Informational) ERC7544 : Security flaws in ERC20 transfer
patterns (tokens sent to contracts can be lost) ERC7546 : Upgradeable clone (proxy
pattern)
ERCs (application layer):
* (Informational) ERC7544 : Security flaws in ERC20 transfer patterns (tokens sent to
contracts can be lost)
(Informational) ERC7544 : Security flaws in ERC20 transfer patterns (tokens sent to
* ERC7546 : Upgradeable clone (proxy pattern)
ERC7546 : Upgradeable clone (proxy pattern)
Stuff for developers
* Solidity v0.8.22 : Adds unchecked loop increments, Yul optimizer rematerializes zero
literals, experimental support to import EVM Assembly JSON and event definition at
file level EVM versions before Constantinople deprecated
Solidity v0.8.22 :
* Adds unchecked loop increments, Yul optimizer rematerializes zero literals,
experimental support to import EVM Assembly JSON and event definition at file level
Adds unchecked loop increments, Yul optimizer rematerializes zero literals,
* EVM versions before Constantinople deprecated
EVM versions before Constantinople deprecated
* Hardhat: Ignition : declarative contract deployment with support for recovery
Hardhat-verify v2 : adds Sourcify verification, enable via config
Hardhat:
* Ignition : declarative contract deployment with support for recovery
Ignition : declarative contract deployment with support for recovery
* Hardhat-verify v2 : adds Sourcify verification, enable via config
* OpenSea Shipyard : NFT libraries & implementations
OpenSea Shipyard : NFT libraries & implementations
* Fe (language) v0.25.0 : fe test adds print logs and filter to only run specific
tests
Fe (language) v0.25.0 : fe test adds print logs and filter to only run specific tests
* evm.storage : supports unverified contracts using bytecode-generated layouts
evm.storage : supports unverified contracts using bytecode-generated layouts
* EVM Glue : EVM assembler in Rust
EVM Glue : EVM assembler in Rust
* Uniswap universal router decoder & encoder in Python
Uniswap universal router decoder & encoder in Python
* halo2-repl : write zk circuits using JavaScript in browser-based REPL for Halo 2
halo2-repl : write zk circuits using JavaScript in browser-based REPL for Halo 2
Security
* Maestro 280 ETH exploit via arbitrary call, users refunded
Maestro 280 ETH exploit via arbitrary call, users refunded
* Aztec Connect vulnerability postmortem , $450k bounty paid, withdraw funds from
zk.money
Aztec Connect vulnerability postmortem , $450k bounty paid, withdraw funds from
* UniPass account abstraction (ERC4337) module vulnerability disclosed
UniPass account abstraction (ERC4337) module vulnerability disclosed
* SEAL drills : protocol incident response testing via simulated attack, drills run
with Compound & Yearn
SEAL drills : protocol incident response testing via simulated attack, drills run with
Compound & Yearn
Ecosystem
* Etherscan account abstraction (ERC4337) transaction display
Etherscan account abstraction (ERC4337) transaction display
* ETH Hong Kong hackathon winners
ETH Hong Kong hackathon winners
Onchain stats
* Gas fees (via ultrasound.money ): 5.3 to 97.5 gwei, with 18.8 gwei average Zero net
issuance currently at 21.6 gwei 2.1k ETH net issuance this week
Gas fees (via ultrasound.money ): 5.3 to 97.5 gwei, with 18.8 gwei average
* Zero net issuance currently at 21.6 gwei
Zero net issuance currently at 21.6 gwei
* 2.1k ETH net issuance this week
2.1k ETH net issuance this week
* ETHUSD : $1,595 - $1,845, currently $1,777
ETHUSD : $1,595 - $1,845, currently $1,777
* ETHBTC : currently 0.053 (Flippening at ~0.16)
ETHBTC : currently 0.053 (Flippening at ~0.16)
Notable at app layer
* Call for open bridge standards
Call for open bridge standards
* Polygon POL token live on mainnet
Polygon POL token live on mainnet
* Gitcoin direct grants : award funds to projects/individuals for deliverables
Gitcoin direct grants : award funds to projects/individuals for deliverables
* Karma grantee accountability protocol for public goods projects; [ Starbloom
portfolio]
Karma grantee accountability protocol for public goods projects; [ Starbloom
* Hats modules : automatic granting/revocation of roles based on conditions
Hats modules : automatic granting/revocation of roles based on conditions
* Slugs (onchain URL shortener) live on Optimism
Slugs (onchain URL shortener) live on Optimism
Job Listings
* eBay Web3 team seeking Lead Solidity Engineer
eBay Web3 team seeking Lead Solidity Engineer
* Gnosis seek a VP Technology , Senior Web Devs (Wallet) & Backend Devs
Gnosis seek a VP Technology , Senior Web Devs (Wallet) & Backend Devs
* ZK circuits engineer sought by EF Privacy & Scaling Explorations team
ZK circuits engineer sought by EF Privacy & Scaling Explorations team
* Senior Operations Security Expert wanted by EF
Senior Operations Security Expert wanted by EF
Job listings: $600 for four issues (75 character limit).Â Questions? abcoathup
at-gmail
Regulation/business/tokens
* Elliptic: correcting WSJ , no evidence Hamas received significant volumes of crypto
donations
Elliptic: correcting WSJ , no evidence Hamas received significant volumes of crypto
* SEC Commissioner Peirce: dissent on LBRY , SECâ€™s misguided enforcement-driven
approach to crypto
SEC Commissioner Peirce: dissent on LBRY , SECâ€™s misguided enforcement-driven approach
to crypto
* BlockFi emerged from bankruptcy
BlockFi emerged from bankruptcy
* Yuga Labs vs Ryder Ripps trademark lawsuit : Yuga awarded $1.5M & RR/BAYC NFT
contract
Yuga Labs vs Ryder Ripps trademark lawsuit : Yuga awarded $1.5M & RR/BAYC NFT contract
* Proposal for Internet Native Company (INC): for-profit org operated & governed
onchain
Proposal for Internet Native Company (INC): for-profit org operated & governed onchain
General
* Okta support system breached , detected by customers BeyondTrust , Cloudflare &
1Password
Okta support system breached , detected by customers BeyondTrust , Cloudflare &
* iLeakage : transient execution side channel targeting Safari browser
iLeakage : transient execution side channel targeting Safari browser
Follow @WeekinEthNews to find out what the most clicked links are. Follow @abcoathup
and @evan_van_ness to get most of the weekâ€™s news in real time.
Permalink for this weekâ€™s issue:
https://weekinethereumnews.com/week-in-ethereum-news-october-28-2023
Upcoming Dates of Note
(new/changes in bold )
* Oct 31 â€“ Road to Devcon grants deadline (max $1k for local meetups)
Oct 31 â€“ Road to Devcon grants deadline (max $1k for local meetups)
* Nov 3-5 â€“ ETH Lisbon hackathon
Nov 3-5 â€“ ETH Lisbon hackathon
* Nov 13-19 â€“ Devconnect (Istanbul), travel advisory
Nov 13-19 â€“ Devconnect (Istanbul), travel advisory
* Nov 15-29 â€“ Gitcoin Grants 19
Nov 15-29 â€“ Gitcoin Grants 19
* Nov 16-19 â€“ Pragma & ETHGlobal Istanbul
Nov 16-19 â€“ Pragma & ETHGlobal Istanbul
* Nov 18 â€“ Ethereum Costa Rica
Nov 18 â€“ Ethereum Costa Rica
* Dec 4 â€“ ETHVenice
Dec 4 â€“ ETHVenice
* Dec 6-7 â€“ Columbia CryptoEconomics workshop (New York)
Dec 6-7 â€“ Columbia CryptoEconomics workshop (New York)
* Dec 8-10 â€“ ETHGlobal ETHIndia (Bangalore)
Dec 8-10 â€“ ETHGlobal ETHIndia (Bangalore)
